Gupta-Vakataka Marriage

He married 'Prabhavatigupta', the daughter of Chandragupta II. This is considered one of the most significant political marriages in Indian history.

тШ╕я╕П
Change of Religion?

The Vakatakas were Shaivites, but Prabhavatigupta was a Vaishnavite. Rudrasena II also became a devotee of Vishnu (Chakrapani).

ЁЯУМ
Important Facts (Exam Points)
  • Premature Death: He died just a few years after his marriage, leading to Prabhavatigupta becoming regent.
